This is a good question for stackoverflow (so that other people can discover this information easier), but there's this utility: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/tools/inspect_checkpoint.py

If I restore a ".ckpt" file without defining any variables, I will get error. However I just want to know what's in that ".ckpt" file. I didn't see any function can achieve it. — You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread. body:
This is a good question for stackoverflow (so that other people can
discover this information easier), but there's this utility:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/tools/inspect_checkpoint.py

On Wed, Dec 14, 2016 at 8:59 PM, oneengineer <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> How can I know what variables or constants in a ".ckpt" file?
>
> If I restore a ".ckpt" file without defining any variables, I will get
> error.
> However I just want to know what's in that ".ckpt" file.
>
> I didn't see any function can achieve it.
>
